reporting_org_narrative: Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC)
title_narrative: Programme d’Hydraulique Rurale – Appui Au Secteur Eau et Assainissement (PHRASEA) Phase 2
description_narrative: Moins de 50% des nigériens ont accès à l’eau potable et seuls 7% disposent de conditions d'assainissement de base. La croissance démographique galopante\, la dispersion de la population sur le territoire et la précarité des finances publiques sont des contraintes empêchant l'accès des populations à ces services de base. Le PHRASEA vient en appui aux efforts du gouvernement\, en misant sur la maitrise d’ouvrage des communes.

title_narrative: Projet intercommunal eau et assainissement (canton d'Illéla - Niger)
description_narrative: Le projet vise à améliorer durablement l'accès à l'eau et à l'assainissement dans les 4 communes du canton d'Illéla (Niger) en renforçant la gouvernance communale et intercommunale des services de l'eau et de l'assainissement (E&A)\, en favorisant l'accès à l'eau potable\, l'hygiène et à l'assainissement\, des populations des 4 communes et en structurant les opérateurs locaux de gestion du service E&A. Les bénéficiaires sonles populations des 23 villages touchés par le projet\, soit 30 000 personnes

reporting_org_narrative: King Salman Humanitarian Aid and Relief Centre
title_narrative: Providing drinking water in the Republic of Niger.
description_narrative:
- Drilling of (163) surface wells ranging from (20 to 30 meters).
- Installation of 163 hand pumps.,1- Implementing sustainable activities to provide safe drinking water to (241\,880 beneficiaries) by digging (163) surface wells.
2- Contribute to reducing the percentage of diseases resulting from drinking contaminated water.
3- Providing water for livestock\, on which the economy of the population in the targeted areas depends.
4- To contribute to stabilizing the population and limiting desertion in order to obtain water sources.
5- Increasing sources of safe drinking water and personal use in dry areas.
6- An increase in the percentage of crop productivity in the targeted areas.,About (241\,880) beneficiaries have access to safe drinking water and daily use in each of the following areas (Dosso / Tillaberi / Tawa).
participating_org_narrative: King Salman Humanitarian Aid and Relief Centre,Al-Wafa World Organization
sector: Basic drinking water supply

reporting_org_narrative: King Salman Humanitarian Aid and Relief Centre
title_narrative: Drilling (6) surface wells in Tlabéri\, Republic of Niger
description_narrative: Providing potable water to the citizens of Niger by digging and preparing wells,Providing a source of safe water for drinking and personal use in the targeted areas with humanitarian needs\, reducing the rate of epidemic diseases\, supporting the economy by providing water for livestock\, which is a source of livelihood for the residents of the targeted areas\, limiting the migration of residents of the area and enhancing living there.,Providing drinking water for personal use to (60\,699) beneficiaries\, preserving livestock and enhancing the local and national economy\, in addition to limiting the spread of epidemic diseases and promoting personal hygiene in a clean and safe environment in the targeted areas.
participating_org_narrative: King Salman Humanitarian Aid and Relief Centre,Al-Wafa World Organization
sector: Basic drinking water supply

reporting_org_narrative: Foreign Affairs\, Trade and Development Canada (DFATD),Affaires étrangères\, Commerce et Développement Canada (MAECD)
title_narrative: Poverty Reduction Local Fund - Phase II,Fonds d'appui à la lutte contre la pauvreté - phase II
description_narrative: The Poverty Reduction Local Fund - Phase II (FALP II) responds to proposals from non-governmental organizations (NGOs) and development associations active in Niger. The funded initiatives helped to build the institutional capacities of partner organizations and to give the poorest\, mainly women and children\, better access to social services and basic nutrition. FALP II focuses its support on the Maradi\, Tillaberi\, and Tahoua regions.,Le Fonds d'appui à la lutte contre la pauvreté\, phase II (FALP II) répond à des propositions d’organisations non gouvernementales (ONG) et d’associations de développement oeuvrant au Niger. Les initiatives ainsi appuyées ont contribué au renforcement des capacités institutionnelles des organisations partenaires et à un meilleur accès à des services sociaux ainsi qu'à une meilleure alimentation de base pour les populations les plus démunies\, principalement les femmes et les enfants. Le FALP II concentre ses appuis dans les régions de Maradi\, Tillabéri et Tahoua.
participating_org_narrative: Canada,Canada,Canadian International Development Agency,Agence canadienne de développement international,Embassy of Canada to Niger,Ambassade du Canada au Niger
contact_info_organisation_narrative: Foreign Affairs\, Trade and Development Canada (DFATD),Affaires étrangères\, Commerce et Développement Canada (MAECD)
sector: Basic sanitation

reporting_org_narrative: Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC)
description_narrative: Depuis la reprise des combats entre les armées nationales de quatre pays et le groupe armé Boko Haram en 2015\, provoquant le déplacement massif de plus de 2\,6 million de personnes à travers la région\, la pression sur les ressources des communautés hôtes et les infrastructures existantes s'est trouvée décuplée\, notamment au Niger. Le présent projet vise à renforcer l'équipe technique de l'UNICEF de ce pays\, laquelle supervise la coordination des projets humanitaires relatifs à l'eau\, l'hygiène et à l'assainissement.

title_narrative: Development of a roadmap for an inclusive and sustainable water governance structure for the river Niger in Niger
description_narrative: The purpose of this project is to contribute an expert planning perspective to the development of a roadmap that will lead to an inclusive and sustainable water governance structure for the river Niger in Niger (country). Good governance of the area of the river is essential for the livelihood of millions of people\, the economy of the country and to prevent conflicts. Especially in the context of rapid climate change and extreme weather (and floods) occurring more often. This project will facilitate the planning process for the development of this roadmap in the beginning of 2021.
participating_org_narrative: Netherlands Enterprise Agency,Van Beek Water Delft,Netherlands Enterprise Agency
sector: River basins development

title_narrative: Project for the installation of a water retention for the regulation of the Sirba river
description_narrative: The project involves the construction of an earth-filled dam\, due to store approx. 7.5 million m3 of water and the development of 70 hectares of arable land near the village of Toure\, in the municipality of Gotheye (Tillabery\, southwestern Niger).,Il progetto prevede la costruzione di una ritenuta d'acqua in terra per potere stoccare ca. 7\,5 milioni di m3 d'acqua e la sistemazione di 70 ettari di terreni nei pressi del villaggio di Toure\, nel comune di Gotheye\, nella regione sud-occidentale nigerina di Tillabery.

reporting_org_narrative: AICS - Italian Agency for Cooperation and Development
title_narrative: Pilot action for job creation and waste enhancement in the City of Niamey
description_narrative: The overall objective of the project is to improve the living conditions of the local population by promoting education to respect the environment by reducing the impact of Niamey's plastics waste\, bringing the current quantity into a sample neighborhood\, from 18% without intervention at 28%\, on an annual basis\, with intervention\, on an annual basis.,L’obiettivo generale del progetto è quello di migliorare le condizioni di vita della popolazione locale promuovendo l’educazione al rispetto dell’ambiente riducendo l’impatto dei rifiuti plastici di Niamey\, portando il quantitativo attuale raccolto in un quartiere esempio\, dal 18% senza intervento al 28%\, su base annua\, con intervento.
participating_org_narrative: AICS - Italian Agency for Cooperation and Development,AICS - Italian Agency for Cooperation and Development,COMUNE DI CARMAGNOLA
